alert.note: Alert for Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 1:41PM MST until January 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Snowy Range. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Falling snow and patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hikers and snowmobilers can easily become disoriented. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two rounds of light to moderate snow are expected during this time. First round of light snow will occur late Monday night and through Tuesday morning. A brief lull with light snow showers is expected Tuesday afternoon through the overnight hours. The second round of moderate snow is expected during the day Wednesday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
